meanings.definition: A device for copying a drawing or plan on a different scale.
meanings.sent1: The pantograph helped the artist enlarge the sketch.
meanings.sent2: The architect used a pantograph to replicate the blueprint.
meanings.sent3: The pantograph made the doodle look like a giant map!
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was a pantograph, transforming small ideas into grand designs.
meanings.sent5: The pantograph, like a magical magnifier, enlarged the image effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A mechanical linkage for transmitting motion.
meanings.sent1: The pantograph in the train allowed for smooth movement.
meanings.sent2: The pantograph connected the wheels to the engine.
meanings.sent3: The pantograph danced along, passing energy from one part to another.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as a pantograph, transferring emotions from his heart to hers.
meanings.sent5: The pantograph hummed with life, transferring power with precision.
